info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:27AM EDT until August 21 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL NICHOLAS AND NORTH CENTRAL FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 426 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northeast of Gauley Bridge, or 13 miles north of Fayetteville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ansted, Gauley Bridge, Hawks Nest State Park, Swiss and Drennan. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
